meanings.definition: To shuffle again or in a different way.
meanings.sent1: She reshuffled the deck of cards to play a new game.
meanings.sent2: After the game, they reshuffled the cards for the next round.
meanings.sent3: The magician reshuffled the cards, making them disappear and reappear in a different order.
meanings.sent4: The wind reshuffled the fallen leaves, creating a beautiful pattern on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The chef reshuffled the ingredients, creating a unique and delicious dish.

meanings.sent1: He reshuffled his schedule to make time for the important meeting.
meanings.sent2: The librarian reshuffled the books on the shelves to make space for new arrivals.
meanings.sent3: The students reshuffled their seating arrangement, causing chaos in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The manager reshuffled the team, assigning new roles to each member.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces were reshuffled, making it challenging to complete the picture.
